thread.title: Forrest General offers new palliative care program
thread.title_full: Forrest General offers new palliative care program - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Forrest General offers new palliative care program
text:
HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) - Forrest General Hospital has a new stand-alone department.
The hospital's new Palliative and Supportive Care Program began seeing its first patients in August. Staffed by Dr. Jacob Graham and Registered Nurse Amber Chancelor, the program focuses on the relief of physical, emotional, social and spiritual suffering associated with serious illness.
One of the program's main objectives is to help relieve patients' symptoms - including pain, shortness of breath, fatigue, nausea and loss of appetite - while coordinating care among patients' health care providers.
The Hattiesburg American reports ( http://hatne.ws/1RwIgVH ) the program also is working with William Carey University to offer music therapy for patients.
Since its inception, the Palliative and Supportive Care Program has seen about 118 patients, averaging 10-11 new consults a week.
Information from: The Hattiesburg American, http://www.hattiesburgamerican.com
